text:
Banks have raked in more than $10 billion in fees from the $349 billion coronavirus small business loan program. Why? There was no risk. The SBA guaranteed the loans. Taxpayers provided the money. 

JPMorgan funneled $141 million to 29 publicly-held companies, all its customers.
